title: Article 641892 -- No Title
description: A 41-year-old California woman who threatened to set herself on fire in front of the United Nations as a protest against using taxes for military spending was held in $100,000 bail yesterday at her arraignment in State Supreme Court in Manhattan.

title: Primerica Posts Earnings, Setting Records All Around
description: The Primerica Corporation notched record earnings of $220.8 million in the first quarter, the company said yesterday, more than doubling the $105.9 million it earned in the period a year ago. Even better, analysts said, it easily surpassed its previous quarterly record, $132.1 million in last year's fourth quarter.

title:
Market Place;
Reconsidering 3 German Giants
description: OVER the last year, Germany's three biggest chemical companies Hoechst, BASF and Bayer -- were mostly absent from industry analysts' recommended lists. With their sales and earnings expected to be weak because of a slowing domestic economy, rising costs and recession in important export markets like the United States, the "Big Three" were seen as avoidable.

title: S.A.S. Merger Wins Approval
description: Scandinavian Airlines System won approval today to merge with the domestic carrier Linjeflyg, creating a near monopoly within Sweden just before deregulation.

title: President Is Retiring At Computer Associates
description: Computer Associates International Inc. said yesterday that Anthony W. Wang was retiring as president and chief operating officer. He will remain on the Islandia, L.I., company's board.

title: Fingerhut Cos.  reports earnings for Qtr to March 27
Jantzen and Bozell Revive '28 Campaign
description: It is back to the future for Jantzen Inc., as the swimwear and sportwear company reintroduces elements of an advertising and marketing campaign initially seen 64 years ago.

title: Bo Is Talking Anything but Baseball
description: BO JACKSON's priority list has baseball "at the bottom of the barrel" for now. Jackson, who had hip replacement surgery April 4, was on crutches yesterday in Chicago at the White Sox home opener, against the Seattle Mariners. He said he had virtually no pain in the left hip that was injured while playing football in January 1991.

title: Business and Health; I.R.S. Studies Pay Of Hospital Chiefs
description: THE Internal Revenue Service is scrutinizing nonprofit hospitals, auditing their executive pay arrangements as part of a sweeping look at the institutions' tax-exempt status. The Government Accounting Office said in 1990 that most such hospitals were not providing enough charity care and other community services to justify their tax exemptions.

title: Departures Leave Big East at Crossroads
description: After 24 years as head coach, and after celebrating his 67th birthday in January, it was merely a matter of time before Lou Carnesecca passed the torch. Still, his retirement announcement yesterday at St. John's was stunning, as much as for its landmark value as for its impact on the Big East conference.

title: Venture Is Developing Ways to Speed Traffic
description: A.T.& T. and the Lockheed Corporation disclosed details yesterday of plans to jointly develop technology to help break up traffic congestion by using A.T.& T.'s "smart cards" and Lockheed's radio transmission technology.

title: Primerica Corp.  reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Included gains of $ 66.9 million, or 59 cents a share, on sales of stock of subsidiary and affiliates, net of income taxes.The operating revenues in 1992 excluded effect of gains on sales of stock of subsidiary and affiliates. Operating revenues in 1991 excluded Fingerhut's revenues of $ 313.8 million.

title: Flooding Closes Trading On Exchanges in Chicago
description: The leading Chicago financial exchanges were closed yesterday as millions of gallons of water flooded basements in the heart of downtown Chicago, but the flooding caused relatively little disruption in financial markets elsewhere. That disruption could grow substantially, though, if the markets do not reopen quickly.

title: American Stores Sale
description: The American Stores Company said today that it had completed the sale of 74 Jewel Osco stores and a general merchandise warehouse to Albertson's Inc. American said it netted about $375 million from the sale, which will be used to reduce long-term debt. The sale covered all of American Stores' operations in Texas, Oklahoma and Florida.

title: Temple-Inland Inc.  reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: Revenues represented total revenues.

title: Only 1% Growth Seen for Western Germany
description: Germany's leading economic research groups today forecast a growth rate of only 1 percent for western Germany this year, down from their earlier prediction of 2 percent and much lower than last year's growth of more than 3 percent.

title: Covington Development Group Inc. reports earnings for Year to Dec 31
description: The company said the major part of its loss last year was caused by the writedowns of real estate inventories to their net realizable value and abandonment of certain projects.

title: Topics of The Times; Carriage Horses: In Danger Again
description: Three years ago an enlightened New York City Council passed a law that spared carriage horses from exposure to screeching brakes, loud honks and potential death on midtown Manhattan streets. It also eased midtown's legendary traffic congestion.

title: Alcoa Off, Alcan Has Loss, but Stocks Rise
description: The Aluminum Company of America and Alcan Aluminium Ltd., two of the world's largest aluminum producers, reported first-quarter results yesterday that were below last year's levels but above analysts' expectations.

title: Paroled Rapist Charged With Killing 5 Women in New Jersey
description: A 25-year-old paroled rapist who had been in prison since he was 14 was charged today with five murders and four rapes in East Orange and Newark that the authorities said began in December, less than a month after his release.

title: For Dinkins, Smaller Salary Proves No Barrier to Charity
description: Mayor David N. Dinkins earned $128,871 last year, just 60 percent of his 1990 income, but he made $15,000 in charitable contributions, nearly 32 times the amount he gave the year before, according to income-tax returns released yesterday at City Hall.

title: Air Carriers Fine-Tune New Fares
description: As airlines struggled yesterday to finish entering new, lower fares into their computer systems, several carriers spent the day altering or fine-turning the plans most of them adopted last week in response to American Airlines' broad changes.

title: Theory on Eruption
description: SCIENTISTS have found evidence that a mixing of two kinds of lava set off the devastating eruption of Mount Pinatubo in the Philippines last June that killed 700 people and forced the closing of Clark Air Force Base.

title: Mesh of Announcers Detracts From the Masters
description: The Masters can be a potboiler or a yawner, but no one should miss the end-of-tournament ceremony awarding the green jacket to the winner. It's like a fashion show in a pro shop, simultaneously amusing and awkward.

title: Professional Charts
description: DELTAGRAPH PROFESSIONAL, for the Macintosh, is meant to produce such a wide range of charts and graphs for a business or individual that users will not have to resort to specialized programs, and to a remarkable extent it succeeds.

title: Lewis Enters Long Jump in New York
description: CARL LEWIS, who will be seeking a third consecutive Olympic gold medal in the long jump this summer in Barcelona, Spain, has entered the long-jump competition of the New York Games on May 24. Lewis, the world-record holder at 100 meters, is widely recognized as the greatest long jumper in history, for his 10-year, 65-meet winning record that was finally broken last summer when MIKE POWELL beat him at the world championships in Tokyo. Even though Powell set the world record at 29 feet 4 1/2 inches, Lewis still managed to reach 29 feet or better three times.

title: With Direct Injections, Gene Therapy Takes A Step Into a New Age
description: SOMETIME within the next month, a patient suffering from advanced melanoma who otherwise has almost no chance of surviving will be the first to receive the ultimate form of human gene therapy.

title: Hilton Hotels Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
Chairman of Pinkerton's Adds to His Responsibilities
description: Thomas J. Wathen, chairman and chief executive of Pinkerton's Inc., will take on the added responsibilities of chief operating officer on June 30 in a move Mr. Wathen described as "planned long ago." Alfred J. Berger, the current chief operating officer, will return to his former role as consultant and outside board member.

title: Kinnock Says He Will Quit as Labor Party Leader
description: Blaming the heavily pro-Conservative British press for the opposition Labor Party's defeat in the election on Thursday, Neil Kinnock said today that he would resign as leader and let a special party convention elect his successor in June.

title: For Iran Chief, a Mandate and a Test
description: President Hashemi Rafsanjani is emerging from Iran's parliamentary elections with both a strong mandate to rebuild the country and the toughest challenge of his political career.

title: THE 1992 CAMPAIGN: Clinton; A Scattered Campaign Brain Trust Diverse in Ideas
description: Every morning at 8 o'clock Little Rock time, the conference call begins. The discussion might include a dozen participants from Los Angeles, Washington, New Haven and Arkansas, but the general topic is always the same: how to make Bill Clinton President.

title: Martin Williams, A Jazz Critic, 67; Wrote on Culture
description: Martin Williams, one of jazz's most influential critics and advocates, died over the weekend at his home in Washington. He was 67 years old.

title: Police Raid and Suit Open Window Into Gypsy Life
description: One afternoon in June 1986, more than 18 police officers raided two modest homes of an extended gypsy family here, looking for stolen property.

title: Safeway Inc.  reports earnings for 12wks to March 21
description: b-After an extraordinary loss of $ 27.8 million related to the early retirement of debt, net of income tax benefit of $ 17.1 million.c-Net incomeEquity in earnings of unconsolidated affiliates declined to $ 8.8 million in the latest first quarter, compared with $ 13.2 million in year-ago period.
